column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of Sr2Mn2CuAs2O2, Sr2Zn2MnAs2O2, and Sr2Mn3As2O2 were prepared by solid state reaction techniques using SrO (99.9% pure), Mn (99.99% pure, Alfa-Aesar), Cu (99.99% pure, Fisher), Zn (99.99% pure, Alfa-Aesar), and As (99.9% pure, Alfa-Aesar) as starting materials.
#Text=The SrO was prepared by heating SrCO3 (99.99% pure, Aldrich) at 1300 ◦C in air for 12 h and cooling under vacuum.
#Text=The stoichiometric mixtures of the starting materials were placed in an Al2O3 crucible that was then sealed inside an evacuated quartz tube.
#Text=The samples were first heated to 610 ◦C at a rate of 80 ◦C/h, held there for 10 h and then heated to 980 ◦C and held there for 20 h.
#Text=The samples were then progressively fired at 980 ◦C and 1000 ◦C for 30 h, each followed by one intermediate grinding and pelletization.
#Text=All the sample handling was carried out inside a He-filled glove box
